alert.note: Alert for Central Tularosa Basin; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 08 at 7:27PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Otero and northeastern Dona Ana Counties through 800 PM MDT... At 726 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of White Sands National Monument. This storm was nearly stationary. Outflow winds ahead of the storm was moving southeast across US-70 at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... White Sands National Monument, Holloman Air Force Base and Lake Lucero. This includes Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 190 and 205. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Central Tularosa Basin; Southern Tularosa Basin
